resources.string: Please enter your User ID (as listed in the letter that you received with this tablet).

The following are a series of cognitive tasks, several of which are the versions of the tasks you completed in the original Project Talent study.

 	• Read the instructions for each task carefully.
 	• Do the best you can. If you are unsure of the right answer, pick the one you think is the best.
 	• If a task includes multiple-choice questions, select only one answer.
 	• There is only one right answer for each question.

 Press the NEXT button to begin the first task.
Please click "Finish" to proceed into next section.
Please take your time to answer.
You have not submitted a response yet.Your answers are important to us.\nPlease try to answer as best you can. If you are not willing to provide an answer, please press NEXT to continue.
You did not complete the question. Your answers are important to us. Please try to answer as best you can. If you are not willing to provide an answer, please press NEXT to continue.
Would you like to quit? Or go back to where you left off?
The correct answer is the figure selected here.
Each item in this task has a drawing of a flat piece of metal, like the example shown here.

Below each drawing are five objects, only one of which can be made by folding the flat piece of metal along the dotted lines. You are to select which object shows just how the piece of flat metal would look when it is folded at the dotted lines. When it is folded, no piece of metal overlaps any other piece, or is enclosed inside the object.
Now look at the example.\n\nSelect which of the five objects would be made by folding the flat piece along each of the dotted lines.
Press the object and then the NEXT button when you are ready to go on.

It follows the same pattern as the other figures in the box. The figure in the bottom left is larger than the one above it but otherwise the same. In the top row, the figure at the right is the same as the one to the left of it except that it has been turned upside down. Following these rules, the missing figure should be larger than the one above it, and exactly the same size as the one to the left of it, but upside down. Therefore, the response choice selected is the correct answer.

That is correct. Of the five objects shown, only this one could be made from the flat piece by folding it at each of the dotted lines.\n\n Press the NEXT button to continue, or the BACK button to go back one page.

No, the correct response is this one. Only it could be made from the flat piece by folding it at each of the dotted lines.\n\n Press the NEXT button to continue, or the BACK button to go back one page.

INSTRUCTIONS

 • For each item, select the object that could be made by folding the flat piece at each of the dotted lines.
 • All folds are indicated by dotted lines.
 • The solid lines show the cuts in the piece.
 • Parts are not folded inside of other parts of any objects (in other words, there is no overlapping).

 When you are ready, press the BEGIN button.

Instructions: In this task, you will see several pictures. Please say the name of the pictured object. To record your answer, press the RECORD ANSWER button. If you do not know what is pictured, just give your best guess.\n\n Please click \'Next\' to see an example.
What is shown in this picture? Press the RECORD ANSWER button and say the name of this object.
For example, if you see a picture of any kind of car, you would just say the word "car".\n You can see this example below.
Please click "Next" to see another example.
What is the arrow pointing to? Press the RECORD ANSWER button and say the name of the object.

In the above example, you would say "eraser". While the picture shows a pencil, the arrow is pointing to a specific part of this pencil – its eraser. Not all pictures will have arrows. In those cases, you are to say the word that best describes the entire picture. So in the above example, if no arrow were present, you would simply say "pencil".

 You will now be asked to identify six more pictures. Take your time. While you do not have an unlimited amount of time to respond to each problem, it is more important to answer correctly than to answer quickly.

 Please click "Next" to begin.

In this next task, we would like to see how quickly you can respond to the words RED and GREEN.

 For the first several items, if you see RED you will press the STOP button. If you see GREEN you will press the GO button.

 Try to be accurate, but respond as quickly as you can.

For example, if you see:

 RED

 You should press the STOP button. Please do this now.

And if you see:

 GREEN

 You should press the GO button. Please do this now.
You pressed GO. Please press the STOP button.
You pressed STOP. Please press the GO button.
This first set will last about 30 seconds. Please press BEGIN when you are ready.
You have not submitted a response. Please press STOP or GO to continue to the next item.
You did not answer the previous item in the time allowed. Please press NEXT to continue to the next item.
You have not responded to the last 5 items. Please choose â€œExitâ€ to exit this task, or choose â€œContinueâ€ to continue this task.

Now you will do just the REVERSE of what you have been doing. So when you see RED you will press the GO button. When you see GREEN you will press the STOP button.\n\n Try to be accurate, but answer as quickly as you can.

For example, if you see:

 RED

 Because the rules are "REVERSE", you should press the GO button. Please do this now.

And if you see:

 GREEN

 You should press the STOP button. Please do this now.

Now we are going to mix up these two types of responses. When you see the word NORMAL, you will respond the way you did at first: RED means "STOP", GREEN means "GO". But when you see the word REVERSE, you will give the reverse responses: RED means "GO", and GREEN means "STOP".

 We will alternate between the NORMAL and the REVERSE every few trials.

 Try to be accurate, but answer as quickly as you can.

So if you see:

 RED

 You should press the STOP button. This is because the last screen said "NORMA\L", and this screen says "RED". Please do this now.

And if you see:

 GREEN

 You should press the GO button. This is because the rules screen said "NORMAL", and this screen says "GREEN". Please do this now.

And if you see:

 RED

 You should press the STOP button. Please do this now.

So if you see:

 GREEN

 You should press the STOP button. This is because the last screen said "REVERSE", and this screen says "GREEN". Please do this now.

Or if you see:

 RED

 You should press the GO button. This is because the rules screen said "REVERSE", and this screen says "RED". Please do this now.

Or if you see:

 RED

 You should press the GO button. Please do this now.
Now, please practice a few times on your own.
We are now ready to begin. This will take about one minute. Please press BEGIN when you are ready.
The word list will now be repeated.
INSTRUCTIONS\n\n This task contains words for you to define. The items are multiple choice - select the best response for each word.
Please enter the number that belongs in each empty box.

You will now see six more questions like the ones you just did.

 Instructions:
 • Please enter the number that belongs in each empty box.
 • An empty box could be at the end of a series or it could be in the middle.
 • You may be asked a question with more than one empty box in the sequence.
 • The numbers might increase, like 2, 4, 6, or decrease, like 6, 4, 2.
 • Some of the items may be easy but others may be hard. Just do the best you can.
 • It is more important to answer the item correctly than to answer quickly, so take a little time to think before answering.
 • In a few cases, more than one number may be correct. Please give only one answer per box. If your answer is one of the correct answers, you will receive credit.
 • You can go on to the next item at any time by clicking 'Next'.

 If you are ready to begin, please click 'Next'.
Please enter the number that belongs in each empty box.

{ \"id\": 1, \"question\": \"Instructions: In this task, on each screen you will be presented with several numbers that make up a series. There will be one or more empty boxes somewhere in the series. Sometimes the empty boxes will be at the end of the series, and sometimes they will be in the middle. Press the number buttons to enter the number that goes in each empty box.\n\n For example:\", \"options\": [1, 2, 3, 4], \"ansPosition\": 2, \"answerText\": \"The answer we were looking for is 3, so the completed sequence is:\" }

{ \"id\": 2, \"question\": \"Below is another example.\", \"options\": [2, 4, 6, 8], \"ansPosition\": 3, \"answerText\": \"The answer we were looking for is 8 because the numbers (2, 4, 6, 8) increase by 2. The completed sequence is:\" }
Instructions\n\n Each item in this task consists of a set of figures arranged in a pattern, formed according to certain rules. Look at the following patterns in example.

The question mark in the lower right corner of the box shows where a figure is missing in the pattern. You are to decide which of the five figures under the pattern belongs where the question mark is.\n\n Please click \"Next\" to continue.

In the case of the example above, the figure in the bottom left is larger than the one above it but otherwise same. In the top row, the figure at the right is the same as the one to the left of it except that it has been turned upside down. Following these rules, the missing figure should be larger than the one above it, and exactly the same size as the one to the left of it, but upside down. Therefore, the choice selected is the correct answer.\n\n Please click \"Next\" to continue.
Here is a practice item. Select the figure that completes the pattern then press \"Next\".

In each problem, you are to decide what figure belongs where the question mark is in the pattern. To do this you have to figure out what the rule is according to which the drawings change, going from row to row, and what the rule is for the changes going from column to column. The items have different kinds of patterns and different rules by which the drawings change.\n\nPlease click Next to continue.
Now look at another problem, which is quite different from either of the previous ones.\n\n Choose the answer that belongs in \"?\" below, then click Next to continue.

Going from left to right, the circles get larger, and going from top to bottom they get darker. Therefore the answer has to be a circle which is the largest of the three sizes, and the darkest. Choices 3 and 5 are both the right size, but 5 is the only large circle with the correct shading. Thus 5 is the only drawing that fits in the pattern formed by the other circles. 5 is the answer that should be chosen.\n\n Please click \"Next\" to continue.

What is the missing figure here? If you study the pattern you will see that going from left to right there is one more line in each figure than in the one to the left of it. Going from top to bottom, the number of lines in any figure is one less than in the figure just above it. Therefore, the missing figure should have three lines. The answer is choice 3 (the three lines, slanting in the proper direction).\n\n Please click \"Next\" to continue.

INSTRUCTIONS

 • You will now be asked six more questions like the ones you just did. 
 • For each problem, decide what rules the pattern follows. Choose the answer that belongs in "?" by clicking the answer below it.
 • Many of the patterns are based on rules that are different from the ones in the sample items. 
 • Do not spend too much time on any one problem. 

 If you are ready to begin, please click "Next".
Would you like to see another example, or are you ready to start this task?
